official_title: A bill to require certain exporters of agricultural commodities to file with the Secretary of Agriculture financial information and to make such information available to the public.
short_title: Agricultural Commodity Export Reporting Act of 1983

summary.text: Agricultural Commodity Export Reporting Act of 1983 - Requires that persons who in a calendar year sell for export from the United States agricultural commodities with a fair market value of more than $100,000,000 shall file a financial report with the Secretary of Agriculture. Sets forth information that must be contained in such report, including a balance sheet and a profit and loss statement.

titles.title: Agricultural Commodity Export Reporting Act of 1983
A bill to require certain exporters of agricultural commodities to file with the Secretary of Agriculture financial information and to make such information available to the public.
